title: Wood Elf
content:
Wood Elf Racial Features Base Racial Speed Darkvision Elven Weapon Training Fey Ancestry Keen Senses Subrace Traits Fleet of Foot Mask of the Wild

Base Racial Speed Darkvision Elven Weapon Training Fey Ancestry Keen Senses

Fleet of Foot Mask of the Wild

Wood Elf is a Subrace of Elf in Baldur's Gate 3. Wood Elves start out with the ability to blend in with their surroundings. While creating your Character in Baldur's Gate 3, you can choose between 11 different types of races. Each of them has their special characteristics and some of them have Sub-Races which provide different Features and Traits.

BG3 Full Game Note: In the full launch of Baldur's Gate 3, Ability Score Points for Races that were present in Early Access are removed. And instead, Ability Score Points in the full game correspond with the Class players will choose.

Wood elves spend their reclusive lives in Faerun's forests. Decades of training in archery and camouflage are enhanced by an otherworldly swiftness.

Wood Elf Features in Baldur's Gate 3

Fleet of Foot: Move up to 10.5m per turn. Mask of the Wild: Proficiency in Stealth.

BG3 Elf Features

Darkvision: See in the dark up to 12m. Keen Senses: Proficiency in Perception. Fey Ancestry: Advantage on Saving Throws against being Charmed, and magic can’t put them to sleep. Elven Weapon Training: Proficiency in Longsword, Shortsword, Longbow and Shortbow.

Wood Elf Tips & Notes

During Early Access, the Wood Elf subrace used to feature +2 Dexterity and +1 Wisdom. This has been changed in the full launch of BG3 and the Ability Score points are now associated with the Class that players will choose. ??

In Other Languages

Español (España): Elfo de los bosques
